newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume slips as prices firm.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume slips as prices firm.

text.p: Volume on the Istanbul gold exchange slipped to 1,108 kilos on Thursday, from Wednesday's 1,294 kilos as gold prices firmed along with trends on the European markets, dealers said.
Gold closed sharply higher in dollar terms at $345.50 an ounce, compared to $342.00 on Wednesday. Lira prices were also higher at 1,506,100 lira per gram, from 1,502,000 lira previously.
But the rise in lira terms was cushioned by the Turkish currency firming against the dollar, dealers said. The lira closed at 136,390 lira to the dollar, from 136,400 on Wednesday.
Of the day's trade 658 kilos took place in the morning session, with 58.5 percent of the total traded in lira terms.
